name: Creatine Monohydrate
notes: Most studied form is monohydrate. Loading 20 g/day split doses x5–7 days is common.

name: Caffeine
notes: Upper end varies by tolerance. Can disrupt sleep; synergistic with L-theanine.

name: L-Theanine
notes: Often paired 2:1 theanine:caffeine for smooth focus.

name: Magnesium (elemental)
synonyms: magnesium citrate;magnesium glycinate;magnesium bisglycinate;magnesium oxide;magnesium malate;magnesium supplement
notes: Glycinate/citrate often better tolerated than oxide.

name: Vitamin D3 (Cholecalciferol)
notes: Dose individualized by serum 25(OH)D and clinician guidance.

name: Vitamin K2 (MK-7)
notes: Often paired with Vitamin D3; interacts with anticoagulants.

name: Fish Oil (Omega-3)
notes: Use with meals to reduce reflux; check EPA:DHA content.

name: Ashwagandha
notes: Standardized extracts vary; titrate to effect.

name: Rhodiola Rosea
notes: Look for standardization to rosavins/salidroside.

name: Berberine
notes: May interact with cytochrome enzymes; GI upset possible.

name: Melatonin
notes: Start low to minimize grogginess.

name: Curcumin
notes: Often combined with piperine or phospholipids for absorption.

name: Ginger
notes: May have mild antiplatelet effects.

name: Green Tea Extract (EGCG)
notes: Take with food to reduce GI discomfort.

name: Niacin (Vitamin B3)
notes: Nicotinic acid may cause flushing; ER cautions apply.

name: N-Acetylcysteine (NAC)
notes: Sulfur odor is normal; hydrate well.

name: Alpha-GPC
notes: Choline donors may cause fishy odor at high doses.

name: Bacopa Monnieri
notes: GI upset possible; take with food.

name: Ginkgo Biloba
notes: Potential antiplatelet effects; check extract standardization.

name: Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10)
notes: Ubiquinol is the reduced form; take with fat-containing meals.

name: Resveratrol
notes: Bioavailability is limited; take away from iron.

name: Chromium Picolinate
notes: Monitor if on glucose-lowering medication.

name: Glucosamine
notes: Often combined with chondroitin; shellfish caution for some forms.

name: Chondroitin
notes: Often combined with glucosamine.

name: MSM (Methylsulfonylmethane)
notes: Frequently paired with glucosamine/chondroitin.

name: Beta-Alanine
notes: Paresthesia (tingles) is benign; split doses.

name: L-Citrulline
notes: Malate form commonly used in sports nutrition.

name: Taurine
notes: Often included in energy drinks; generally well tolerated.

name: Zinc (elemental)
notes: Take away from iron/calcium to optimize absorption.

name: Vitamin B12
notes: Form and route depend on absorption status.

name: 5-HTP (5-Hydroxytryptophan)
notes: Use enteric-coated forms with food; avoid combining with serotonergic drugs.

name: Glycine
dose: 3–5 g at bedtime or per need
notes: Dissolves readily in water; may support sleep quality and thermoregulation.

name: Lion's Mane Mushroom
notes: Standardize to hericenones/erinacines; monitor for mushroom allergies.

name: Piperine (Black Pepper Extract)
notes: Enhances bioavailability via CYP3A4 and P-gp inhibition; monitor drug interactions.

name: St. John's Wort
notes: Potent inducer of CYP3A4 and P-gp; significant drug-supplement interactions.

name: Acetyl-L-Carnitine (ALCAR)
notes: Supports mitochondrial energy and may pair with alpha-lipoic acid.

name: Alpha-Lipoic Acid (ALA)
notes: Take on an empty stomach for best absorption; can lower blood glucose.

name: Warfarin
notes: High
examine_slug: Keep vitamin-K intake consistent; frequent INR monitoring required

name: Aspirin
notes: Antiplatelet and pain relief; avoid with other NSAIDs

name: Ibuprofen
notes: Antiinflammatory; increases bleeding risk; may reduce aspirin efficacy

name: Acetaminophen
notes: Pain reliever; high doses can increase INR with warfarin

name: Naproxen
notes: Antiinflammatory; bleeding risk with anticoagulants

name: Omeprazole
notes: Reduces stomach acid; may affect absorption of other drugs

name: Pantoprazole
notes: PPI for GERD

name: Metformin
notes: Type 2 diabetes; avoid excess alcohol; B12 monitoring

name: Lisinopril
notes: Blood pressure; monitor potassium levels

name: Atorvastatin
notes: Cholesterol lowering; myopathy risk with some interactions

name: Simvastatin
notes: Statin; avoid grapefruit; myopathy risk

name: Levothyroxine
notes: Hypothyroidism; take on empty stomach

name: Amlodipine
notes: Blood pressure; grapefruit interaction

name: Losartan
notes: Blood pressure; monitor potassium

name: Metoprolol
notes: Blood pressure and heart rate

name: Sertraline
notes: Antidepressant; serotonin syndrome risk

name: Escitalopram
notes: Antidepressant; serotonin and bleeding risks

name: Fluoxetine
notes: SSRI; long half-life; CYP interactions

name: Citalopram
notes: SSRI; QT prolongation at high doses

name: Alprazolam
notes: Anxiety; CNS depressant; dependence risk

name: Lorazepam
notes: Benzodiazepine; CNS depression with alcohol

name: Zolpidem
notes: Sleep aid; CNS depressant

name: Prednisone
notes: Antiinflammatory; many interactions and side effects

name: Albuterol
notes: Bronchodilator for asthma

name: Montelukast
notes: Asthma and allergies

name: Fexofenadine
notes: Allergy relief; non-sedating

name: Cetirizine
notes: Antihistamine; minimal sedation

name: Loratadine
notes: Non-drowsy antihistamine

name: Diphenhydramine
notes: Sedating antihistamine; CNS effects

name: Omega-6 Fatty Acids
notes: Inflammatory precursor; balance with omega-3

name: Turmeric
notes: Antiinflammatory; bleeding risk with anticoagulants

name: Garlic
notes: Cardiovascular support; antiplatelet effects

name: Milk Thistle
notes: Liver support; may affect drug metabolism

name: Echinacea
notes: Immune support; avoid in autoimmune conditions

name: Valerian
notes: Sleep aid; CNS depression with other sedatives

name: Kava
notes: Anxiety; hepatotoxicity risk; avoid with liver issues

name: Saw Palmetto
notes: Prostate health

name: Cranberry
notes: Urinary tract health; may interact with warfarin

name: Black Cohosh
notes: Menopause symptoms; potential liver concerns

name: Fenugreek
notes: Blood sugar support; may affect warfarin

name: Hawthorn
notes: Heart health; may interact with cardiac drugs

name: Red Yeast Rice
notes: Contains lovastatin; statin-like effects and risks

name: Glucomannan
notes: Weight management; may reduce drug absorption

name: Spirulina
notes: Nutrient-dense; immune modulation

name: Chlorella
notes: Detoxification support

name: Lutein
notes: Eye health

name: Zeaxanthin
notes: Macular health

name: Astaxanthin
notes: Powerful antioxidant; eye and skin health

name: Lycopene
notes: Prostate and cardiovascular health

name: Beta-Carotene
notes: Converted to vitamin A; avoid high doses in smokers

name: Vitamin A
notes: Vision and immune; teratogenic at high doses

name: Vitamin E
notes: Antioxidant; bleeding risk at high doses

name: Vitamin C
notes: Antioxidant and immune support

name: Vitamin B1
notes: Energy metabolism

name: Vitamin B2
notes: Energy and antioxidant

name: Vitamin B3
notes: Cholesterol; flushing at high doses

name: Vitamin B5
notes: Coenzyme A synthesis

name: Vitamin B6
notes: Amino acid metabolism; neuropathy at very high doses

name: Vitamin B7
notes: Hair; skin; and nail health

name: Vitamin B9
notes: DNA synthesis; important in pregnancy

name: Folate
notes: Methylation and DNA synthesis

name: Vitamin K
notes: Clotting; antagonizes warfarin

name: Vitamin K1
notes: Coagulation; found in leafy greens

name: Calcium
notes: Bone health; may interfere with absorption of other minerals

name: Iron
notes: Anemia prevention; avoid with tea/coffee; GI upset

name: Potassium
notes: Electrolyte; caution with ACE inhibitors and ARBs

name: Selenium
notes: Antioxidant; thyroid function; toxic at high doses

name: Copper
notes: Enzyme cofactor; balance with zinc

name: Manganese
notes: Bone and metabolism

name: Chromium
notes: Glucose metabolism

name: Molybdenum
notes: Enzyme cofactor

name: Boron
notes: Bone and hormone health

name: Silicon
notes: Connective tissue health

name: Collagen
notes: Skin; joint; and bone support
